intro: Linanthus watsonii subsp. dolomiticus, commonly known as the Dolomite flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. This subspecies typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils, often found in limestone or dolomite areas. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing features that help it conserve water and survive in harsh conditions.
